direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 3   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's with the pot bellies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Research shows people like fat weathermen. It makes them feel safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like the one in the green and the one in the brown, but I want to see the one in the green with less sideburns and the one in the brown with more, then I'll make my decision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abby! LARRY, 50's, the pompous, uptight anchor man, catches up to them. He wears a makeup bib.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning, Larry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry to do this to you, Abby, but I don't think I can work with her anymore. It's bad enough I have to take her criticism at home. I can't do it on air, too. A man can only take so much. Abby nods, taking him seriously, but you can tell she's done this before.

direction.raw_text: You're not a man, Larry... (off his look) You're a newsman. A newsman isn't defined by the easy times, Larry, he's defined by the difficult ones. Can you imagine Ted Koppel or Chris Hansen or Anderson Cooper having their wives as co-anchor? Hell, no, because they couldn't handle it. But you can. You've got balls the size of Volkswagens. Don't think I haven't noticed. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 3   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re his balls) I've only thought of them as blue as of late, but you're right. They are quite sizeable. But not disproportionately so. (with pride) I like to think of them as aesthetically pleasing -- Abby steps away, not wanting to ponder Larry's balls anymore than she has to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I've made my point. Larry nods, appeased, as she reaches the door marked ABBY RICHTER, PRODUCER, "ALBUQUERQUE A.M." She enters and... 4   INT. KPHX - ABBY'S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS                                4 ...walks in on a shouting match between JOSH, a leftist angry news writer, and DORI, the entertainment-leaning co-writer.

direction.raw_text: Josh, nobody in Sacramento gives a                              * crap about trees in Alaska! It's not newsworthy.

direction.raw_text: He's trying to kill me! He knows I can't eat crab, I'm allergic to it! (to the room) Does anyone see this? Is this a hive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks like syphilis to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Josh) See that? You wouldn't even know what syphilis looks like if it weren't for my story on Paris Hilton. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Abby) She doesn't eat crab or beef or fish. She doesn't eat anything but chicken. You don't need a chef on this show. You need a box of McNuggets. Everyone shouts at each other. Abby calmly pulls out a whistle, puts it to her mouth and BLOWS. 5   INT. KPHX - "SACRAMENTO AM" SET - MORNING                             5* Cameras roll as the chef happily cooks away on the set. Georgia and Larry taste samples of what he's prepared.

direction.raw_text: I have to tell you, Bruce. This is the best Chicken Kiev I've ever tasted.

direction.raw_text: Can I take home the leftovers? They all laugh.

direction.raw_text: When we return, our live Skycam traffic update and more on David Beckham's hundred thousand dollar tattoo.

direction.raw_text: And what you can do to help preserve the ancient forests of Alaska -- and how it might help your Albuquerque electric bill. 6   INT. KPHX - CONTROL ROOM - MORNING                                    6* Abby and Joy stand next to CLIFF, the show's director.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to commercial. (to Abby) I don't know how you do it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 6                                                                      6 CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just a matter of staring the chaos in the eye and showing it who's boss. Nice work, guys. She pats him on the back and heads out of the control room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart wants to see you. He's freaking out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That means he got the numbers. 7   INT. KPHX - STUART'S OFFICE - DAY                                     7 Abby talks to STUART WARDLOW, 60's, KPHX's curmudgeonly general manager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen the ratings for yesterday? We got beat by all the network shows, plus a rerun of "Who's the Boss". The one where the vacuum breaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a temporary setback. This week we'll do better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guy with the cable access show on Channel 83 does better. If we programed Jerry Springer re-runs, we'd do a nine share at a quarter the price. Abby looks worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please tell me you're not thinking of killing the show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not, but I can guarantee you that's what the new management's thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stuart, "Sacramento AM" is an award-                         * winning news program. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 7   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Management doesn't listen to awards. It listens to numbers. We're not a family-run station anymore, Abby. You're good at what you do, but you've got to get me some numbers. I've got two daughters in college and a son in beauty school. I don't know how much you know about Vidal Sassoon but that shit ain't cheap. Abby nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can count on me, Stuart. 8   INT. KPHX - WOMEN'S BATHROOM - DAY                                    8* Abby and Joy stand at the sinks.     Abby compulsively flosses         * in front of the mirror.                                                *

direction.raw_text: I can't be letting corporate management dictate the content of this show. This is my show. I control it. She rips out an extra two feet of floss.                               *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should cancel my date tonight and                       * make a list of ideas for sweeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely not. You should be out, observing humanity. Humanity's who watches our show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, all 2.47% of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've already rescheduled on this guy three times. You cancel tonight and he's gone. He's read more than a dozen books, he has a 401K and he's cute. She holds up her clipboard, which has the guy's E-Harmony PROFILE and PHOTO. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 8    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Look at this bone structure. This could be the bone structure of your future children. Don't you want them to be symmetrical? Abby stops flossing and looks at Joy.                                     *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You printed his profile?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? I'm married. I live vicariously through your dating life. And I really think that this could be our next boyfriend. C'mon, he had nine out of ten items on your checklist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, technically eight and a half. He said he could cook, but when I pressed him, he was completely unfamiliar with cumin. Don't you think that's a little suspicious? Off Joy's look, we CUT TO... 9    EXT. UPSCALE RESTAURANT - NIGHT                                       9 Sacramento's nicest restaurant. Diners enter and exit.                    * 10   INT. UPSCALE RESTAURANT - FOYER - NIGHT                            10 Abby approaches the FEMALE HOSTESS, at her podium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. I'm looking for a guy with sandy brown hair, athletic build, and blue eyes... he's 5'9 which -- I know what you're thinking -- it's a little short, but he's read The Great Gatsby twice, so we'll just live with it, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Technically, I'm 5'9 and 3/4. She turns, mortified, to see JIM, 30's and good-looking. Actually, he's better looking in person than in his photo. Abby gulps. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Jim -- hey. Hi. Hey.

direction.raw_text: You know what? This is not the best angle. We should get the table over there. Then we both get a view, instead of one of us looking at the busboy station.

direction.raw_text: I'm fine here.

direction.raw_text: No, trust me. It'll be better over there. He looks at her like she's crazy, as they get up and move. 12   ANTOHER TABLE - MOMENTS LATER                                      12 The waiter is now taking their drink order.

direction.raw_text: Can I get you some water for the table?

direction.raw_text: Bottle of flat, please.

direction.raw_text: You know, they've done studies that show tap water is no different from bottled water. And they passed a law recently to have all restaurants filter their tap water. So, technically it's not tap water. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) It's filtered water, which is exactly what bottled water is, except you don't have to pay $7 for it.

direction.raw_text: No, but since you have nine out of ten of the necessary attributes on my checklist, I just wanted to make sure this goes as smoothly as possible. As Jim processes this, the waiter arrives with drinks.

direction.raw_text: Thank you. He takes a huge sip, relieved. Abby looks at him.

RESTAURANT PARKING LOT- NIGHT                                13 Jim and Abby walk to their cars. Jim is walking faster than she is, trying to get away. She trots along, trying to keep up.

direction.raw_text: Next time we could go bowling. I noticed online that you're the mid- ranked amateur in the state. I mean, if there is a next time. I'm not trying to be presumptuous, but I am getting a pretty good vibe here... (CONTINUED)

ABBY'S CONDO - BATHROOM - NIGHT                              16 As Abby flosses in front of the mirror... 17   INT. ABBY'S CONDO - BEDROOM - SAME TIME - NIGHT                   17 ...D'Artagnan hisses at the TV and steps on the remote control. ON TV - the channel jumps to a cable access show. MIKE ALEXANDER, 30's, handsome but not pretty, proudly dressed in an outfit that costs less than fifty dollars, addresses the camera. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: You want the truth! But you can't handle the truth. `Cause it's -- MOTLEY GROUP Ugly! THE THEME SONG for "The Ugly Truth" kicks in over a series of past scenes: Mike judo-kicking an giant Oprah doll. direction.raw_text: I'm Mike Alexander and we're back with the "The Ugly Truth." Tonight, as always, we're going to talk about what it is men and women really want in relationships. I've been looking through some books... He holds up several books in his hands, reading the titles.

direction.raw_text: Billions and billions of dollars wasted on self-help psychobabble. Mike lights a match and tosses it on the books, setting them ablaze. Then opens up his jacket and takes out a stick with a marshmallow. Begins roasting the marshmallow on the flame.

direction.raw_text: Now listen up, ladies, cause I'm only gonna say this once tonight and it's just three little words. No, they're not "I love you." Here goes... MEN. ARE. SIMPLE. We can not be trained. All this "Men Are From Venus" bullshit is a waste of your time and money. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: You want to be a lonely hag, then keep reading these stupid books. You want a relationship, here's how you get one: it's called a Stairmaster. Get on it and get skinny and get some trashy lingerie because at the end of the day, all we're interested in is looks. No one falls in love with your personality at first sight, they fall in love with your tits and your ass. And they stick around because of what you're willing to do with them. You want to win a man over? You don't need ten steps. You need one. And it's called a blow- job. Mike shoves a burnt marshmallow into his mouth.

direction.raw_text: My point exactly, Shrek. Next caller. 21   INT. ABBY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS                        21 Abby, now infuriated, picks up the phone and begins dialing. WE INTERCUT between the stage and her apartment, as Mike continues his rant.

direction.raw_text: Men don't fall in love. Men fall in "want." We want things. We're hunters and gatherers. We're the same as we were when we were cavemen and a gillion years of evolution hasn't done squat. Trust me, there was a Pamela Anderson of cave women and all the cave guys were trying to stick their dicks in her. Mike walks over to a chalk board with the word "LOVE" on it. direction.raw_text: Now girls, if you want to think lust is the same as love, that's fine, but you're delusional. Let's take some more calls. (picks up the phone) You're on the air. Abby is now on the phone.

direction.raw_text: Well, of course you don't think so. Ugly people never know they're ugly. It's like people who have B.O. They never know it because they're surrounded by their own stench all the time. Now Abby's really fuming. She snaps a sheet violently.                 *

direction.raw_text: Morning, Freddy. The security guard just looks at her and shakes his head, disappointed. Stuart rushes up to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you said we had him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He quit this morning. I got a smug call from Channel 4 saying they closed a deal with him. Corporate's having a shit fit. What the hell happened? Abby is hurt and stunned, but overcomes it with fierce and abiding hatred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't need Mike Alexander. He's a dime a dozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You better hope so, because you're going to find me a new one by the end of the week. 100   INT. KPHX - WAITING AREA - DAY                                   100 Abby and Joy walk through the waiting area, which is filled with MIKE ALEXANDER REPLACEMENT HOPEFULS of all different shapes and sizes. Abby points at candidates, while Joy makes notes on a clipboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. No. Yes. No. No. (then) I can't believe I even considered for a second allowing myself to feel something for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I still can't believe that you broke up with Colin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know I can't control everything. As much as I'd like to. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 100   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) But I should at least be able to decide who I feel something for and who I'm repulsed by. She turns back to the candidates, frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. No. No. Yes. Fuck no. 101   INT. KPQU, CHANNEL 4 STAGE - DAY                                  101 Channel 4's brighter and more expensive stage, with a prominent logo for "MORNING MAYHEM WITH MIKE!" Mike, dressed in an Armani suit, glandhands the Channel 4 suits, as they show him around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think of the new set?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: retained the copyright to your old segment title, so we retitled you "Morning Mayhem with Mike!" Mike's on autopilot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is Joe, your new producer. Mike finally wakes up a bit.     Turns to Joe, a balding nebbish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I like best about you, Joe? I don't want to have sex with you at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm -- relieved to hear that. The Big Wigs chortle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much do we love this guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 102   EXT. MIKE'S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY                             102 Mike, in his suit, walks up the front steps. Jonah sits on a lawn chair, drinking a soda and watching -- IN THE NEARBY VALLEY Hundreds of multi-colored, multi-shaped HOT AIR BALLOONS are aloft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dude, check it out. Balloon Fiesta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you look like a lawyer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: New station. New wardrobe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're never going to get any pussy looking like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where do you get this stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at me, Jonah. I'm 38, I'm still single, I live alone... Does it look like it's all working out? If there's one thing you don't want to be, it's like me. As he opens the door and goes inside, Jonah calls out -- JONAH I'm pretty sure you don't want to open your new show with that. 103   EXT. FIELD - DAY                                                 103 On the field that is covered with hot air balloons and their pilots and aficionados, Abby and Joy stand with Mike's replacement -- JACK MAGNUM, a fast-talking slickster who thinks he's really fucking cool. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 103   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's my skin? Too shiny?     How are my pores?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tiny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which side is better? Left? Right? Full-frontal? Joy looks at Abby, a little worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're all fine. But let's go over your intro. (prompting him) "I'm Jack Magnum and this is..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Ugly Truth! He fake-smiles and does the "point-and-shoot", going so far as to blow the smoke off his fingertip gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh-kay.   Let's maybe lose the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?   The gun is my signature move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless the NRA is paying your mortgage this month, I say lose the fucking gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we're live in -- five, four, three, two -- 104   INT. KPHX - CONTROL ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS                      104 Stuart sits in the control room next to Cliff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think this guy's any good?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He better be. ON THE MONITORS -- (CONTINUED) 105.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 104   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack Magnum does his intro, now standing in a balloon basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and this is The Ugly Truth! Jack starts to do "the gun", but then he remembers and awkwardly turns it into a peace sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peace!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Jesus. He's going political. 105   INT. MIKE'S APARTMENT - DAY - SAME TIME                             105 Jonah watches TV as Mike gets a beer out of the fridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dude, check this out. Your replacement's on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My what? Mike looks over to see -- ON THE TV -- Live footage from the Balloon Fiesta. Jack Magnum continues to alienate his audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Most of you are watching this show so you can learn how to get chicks. Let me assure you, you're in good hands. You're looking at a guy who's personally had sex with over
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: women. Most of them conscious. 106   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                       106 Abby looks at Joy, panicked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's ad-libbing. Why is he ad- libbing? There's no ad-libbing. 107   INT. MIKE'S APARTMENT - DAY - CONTINUOUS                            107 Mike sits down on the couch to watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, this is beautiful. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 107   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack Magnum just makes it worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're here at the Balloon Fiesta, and I'm supposed to be telling you men are full of hot air, but I think we all know, it's the ladies that are full of crap. Just because she says no, doesn't mean she means no. At this Jack Magnum is tackled and pushed out of the balloon basket. After a moment -- A frazzled ABBY pops up in his place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi! I'm sorry, but Jack Magnum will no longer be able to do "The Ugly Truth" segment. Which should really come as no surprise. Because men are completely unreliable. 108   INT. KPHX - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                     108 Stuart and Cliff watch from the control room, in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is she doing? The PHONE RINGS. Stuart picks up, then blanches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Harold. Yes, I know -- we're fixing it. 109   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                    109 Abby stands in the basket, still nervous, but flying on adrenaline. Joy gives her a "keep going" hand gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take Mike Alexander, for instance. He up and quit the show without so much as a word. You think you know what men are going to do, you think you know what they want to do...but when it comes down to the moment where they actually have to nut up, they turn around and do something completely different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 110   INT. MIKE'S APARTMENT - DAY - CONTINUOUS                         110 Mike stares at Abby on TV for a second, then grabs his keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm all over this. He races out, as Jonah calls after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think she's into you,guy! 111   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                    111 Joy and the camera guy watch as Abby gains steam, ranting to the camera. B-CAMERA, strapped to the basket, also records.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The big, strong, romantic men we've been reading about in novels and watching in movies since we were nine? They're fallacies. "Blue Lagoon" is a total freakin' lie. Men are not strong. Men are not brave. Men are afraid. 112   INT. KPHX - "SACRAMENTO AM" SET - DAY                            112 * From the news desk, Georgia and Larry watch the monitor, confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love "Blue Lagoon". Georgia squeezes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you do, honey. 113   EXT. FIELD - PARKING LOT - DAY - CONTINUOUS                      113 Mike's truck careens into the parking lot. He gets out, racing towards the field. 114   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                    114 Abby is now on a total tear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...They're afraid to say what they feel. Afraid to grow up. Afraid to tell the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 115   INT. MIKE'S APARTMENT - DAY - CONTINUOUS                         115 Jonah watches, entranced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like she's in his brain! 116   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                    116 Mike pushes through the crowd of balloon lovers. 117   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                    117 Abby continues her impassioned tirade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if they have a moment in a hotel elevator that's totally romantic and filled with potential, men are completely incapable of copping to it. Because men are weak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me tell you something about women. She turns to see -- MIKE standing there. He pushes past Joy and climbs into the balloon. Grabbing the mic from Abby's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey -- MIKE (ignoring her; to camera) Women would have us believe that they are the victims. They aren't. They want us to think that we break their hearts for sport. That's crap. They say they want romance. They say they want true love, but all they want is a checklist. Is he perfect? Is he handsome? Is he a doctor? 118   INT. KPHX - CONTROL ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS                      118 A confused Cliff looks at Stuart, who's still on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he quit. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 118   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (now elated; into phone) See? I told you she'd get him back. 119   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                 119 Abby glares at Mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is not true. BY THE CAMERAMAN, Joy shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, kinda true. Mike continues his rant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You men that fit the criteria -- don't kid yourselves. They're not sleeping with you. They're sleeping with a carefully calculated set of venal choices. Money over substance. Looks over soul. Polish over principles. No gesture, no matter how real or romantic, will ever compensate for a really impressive list of credentials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Says the man who's never made a gesture except for this one -- She makes the universally known "jack-off" hand gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, the elevator wasn't a gesture?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The elevator was a moment of passion, followed by a moment of panic on your part, apparently. 120   INT. KPHX - CONTROL ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS                   120 Stuart looks at Cliff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What elevator?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 121   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                 121 Mike glares at Abby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came by your room!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then you ran away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that wasn't panic, sweetheart. It was an unwillingness to compete with the walking checklist that was in your bed. You should be thanking me. NEARBY, Joy taps her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have ten seconds. An OVERZEALOUS BALLOON PILOT walks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we ready to soar up, up and away? IN THE BASKET, Mike looks at the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's the Ugly Truth, folks. A girl in heat for two guys will always pick the one with the better resume. BEHIND HIM, the Pilot silently boards the balloon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is bullsh -- The TORCH of the BALLOON is suddenly fired, covering her FBC violation. The cameraman follows the balloon as it slowly starts to rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...And we're out. (then; sotto) Keep rolling on B-camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 122   INT. HOT AIR BALLOON BASKET - SKY - DAY - CONTINUOUS               122 Abby glares at Mike, not realizing they're still on the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate you so much I just swore on live television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you hate yourself for being so shallow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off we go! Abby and Mike spin around to look at him.       Realizing the balloon is now soaring upwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going anywhere with you. Mike starts to climb out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a shock. You're bailing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't recommend that... Mike looks down to see -- They are now FIFTEEN FEET ABOVE THE GROUND. And rising.         He stops climbing, as the balloon continues to float up and away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, who wants champagne? 123   INT. KPHX - CONTROL ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS                        123 Stuart and Cliff stare at the monitors, eating it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't know the camera is on, do they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nuh-uh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 124   EXT. SKY - DAY - A MOMENT LATER                                  124 Now holding champagne glasses, a disgusted Mike and Abby look at opposite ends of the sky, hating that they are trapped together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! I know -- we can pass the time with you telling me how much fun you and Colin had having sex in Los Angeles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I broke up with Colin in Los Angeles, jackass. Mike is thrown, turning to look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To our left, we have the Sandia Mountains, glistening in the afternoon twilight... Abby ignores the pilot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that got your interest? If you think we're going to finish what we started in LA, you're out of your mind. You lost your chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And to our right, you'll see the Rio Grande River winding its way through the diochramatic landscape... Mike ignores the pilot as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never had a chance with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And off in the distance, we have the Petroglyph National Monument, where -- ABBY (to the Pilot) Can you stop talking, please? (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 124   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (to Mike) You're right. I had a momentary lapse in judgement where I thought you might be more than you are. But you aren't. Clearly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I'm Mike Alexander. I like girls in Jello. I like to fuck like a monkey. Don't fall in love -- it's `scary.'" 125   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                      125 Joy talks on the phone to Stuart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, I saw this coming, so I got us a three second delay. 126   INT. HOT AIR BALLOON BASKET - SKY - DAY - CONTINUOUS               126 Mike glares at Abby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, it is "scary." It's fucking terrifying. Especially because I'm in love with a psycho like you. 127   INT. MIKE'S APARTMENT - DAY - CONTINUOUS                           127 Jonah now sits with Elizabeth.       They both stare at the TV in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he just say -- JONAH "Love"? 128   INT. KPHX - "ALBUQUERQUE AM" SET - DAY - CONTINUOUS                128 Georgia and Larry look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 129   INT. HOT AIR BALLOON BASKET - SKY - DAY - CONTINUOUS          129 Abby stares at Mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not a psycho.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just told you I loved you and all you heard was "psycho". You are the definition of neurotic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The definition of neurotic is a person who suffers from anxiety, obsessional thoughts, compulsive acts and physical ailments without having any objective evidence of disease -- MIKE Again, I just told you I'm in love with you and you're standing here giving me a vocabulary lesson. (to the Pilot) Back me up on this, buddy...who here is afraid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just going to drink my champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in love with me.      Really. Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beats the shit out of me, but I am. Abby opens her mouth, about to make a retort, then realizes what's been said to her. For the first time in her life, she stops thinking and -- Grabs Mike and kisses the hell out of him. The sheer force of her kissing THROWS them into the pilot, causing -- The torch to FLAME radically. The balloon WHOOSHES upwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 130   INT. KPHX - CONTROL ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS                      130 An elated Stuart picks up the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joy, how do you feel about a promotion? 131   EXT. FIELD - DAY - CONTINUOUS                                    131 On the phone, Joy hi-fives the cameraman, then quickly composes herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel good about it. 132   INT. HOT AIR BALLOON BASKET - SKY - DAY - CONTINUOUS             132 Abby finally loosens her grip on Mike. Hair askew, he looks a little like he's been hit by a cyclone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you say "just kidding", I'm going to throw you out of this balloon and watch your body splatter to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going to threaten me with death when we have sex? Because it might be distracting. The Pilot looks worried for his safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I suggest you wait until we land? Abby and Mike keep kissing as the balloon sails into the sunset, and we FADE TO BLACK, then CUT TO -- 133   EXT. BOTANICAL GARDENS - DAY                                     133 CLOSE ON Mike, as he addresses the camera. He holds a mic, wears a tuxedo and speaks in a hushed voice. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 133   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As many of you know, sometimes a guy's gotta admit what he thought was the truth isn't necessarily the whole truth. Yes, women have a checklist, but sometimes that list includes a foul-mouthed idiot who took way too long to realize he was in love. (holds up a finger) Let's continue this conversation in a second. WE PULL BACK to REVEAL -- Mike is standing in a garden with rows and rows of WEDDING GUESTS seated behind him. An altar with flowers and a minister wait patiently. Mike gestures for the camera to follow him as he makes his way up to the altar. As he arrives he greets his groomsman, JONAH, also wearing a tux. He only has eyes for Joy, Abby's bridesmaid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has anyone ever told you you have a stupendous bosom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not lately, so feel free to say it again. A string quartet's version of "HERE COMES THE BRIDE" begins, as we PAN OVER to see -- ABBY, in a wedding dress, about to make her way up the aisle. Looking absolutely beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoom in on this, guys. I want the whole city to see how lucky I am. The cameraman ZOOMS IN on Abby, as she catches Mike's eye and smiles. IN THE AUDIENCE, Elizabeth takes photo after photo. Her date -- a dead ringer for Jim Morrison -- looks at her, amused. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 133   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? No one's ever going to believe this. I need proof. AT THE ALTAR, Abby finally arrives and looks at Mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hope you don't mind, but we're live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, what's Jorge doing so close? We need a master.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew about this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello...I'm the producer. It's sweeps week. How do you think I got them to pay for this? She gestures to -- BOB and HAROLD from Corporate, who sit in the audience. Mike looks momentarily surprised, then -- MIKE God, I love you. He turns to the camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, here it is, guys. The games, the manipulation, the ploys, the tactics... all the things we do to think we're in control. But guess what? We never are. Abby leans over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't it beautiful? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Numbered Script - 2/14/2008 133   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction
